body:
A controversy is a document (tweet or article) which has a sentiment score below -70% (and passes our filtering criteria). 

The Environment risk score is simply the % of environment related controverses within the total environment document corpus of a specific company.

**Environmental RISK Score \[%] = ∑ (Controverses) / ∑ (Documents)**

*ex: company A has a total of 300 documents, 100 of which are classified as belonging to the Environment main topic, 4 of these articles have sentiment scores below -70% which results in a 4% risk score.*

To learn more about how the sentiment scoring works, visit [this link](https://coda.io/@wequity-app/wequity-methodology-101)
